text: Guys, in today's video we will talk about UseMemoHook Why we should use it and most importantly how to use it You just like this video and write ReactOP in the comment section below Let's go to the computer screen Let's roll the intro Intro So we will talk about UseMemoHook which is very much confused in React I will open VS Code here And I will make a new VEET app Just like I was making NPM, create VEET, atlay test So I will simply hit the dot and hit enter And select React and JavaScript and hit NPM install So this is a basic counter app If you have not installed VEET or not used it Or you are watching this video directly Just to understand UseMemo, then follow the steps And you will get a React app After this, I will simply start my server This video is part of the Sigma web development series But if you want to understand UseMemo, then you can watch this video So what I will do is run my server by running NPM run dev So I will run NPM run dev and my server will start And it gives a basic VEET app which increases the count by clicking on count A basic counter app Now what is UseMemo? To understand UseMemo, I will take an example of an extreme case In which I will tell you that if you have an application Which is doing a very intensive task Like suppose you have an array of nums Suppose it has a lot of numbers I will simply say that make a new array And make an array of 30 million entries You can do more, but I think 30 million should be enough for this example After this, I will fill it from zero Dot fill is a method What will it do?
